inn1.comm: goodish length on off, comes forward to defend with a straight bat
pitched up, 84mph on off stump, Roy clamps his bat down on it
pushed across the right-hander, hits the seam and wobbles away, Roy shoulders arms
solid straight bat from Roy, pushed an 86mph length ball towards mid-on

touch fuller, Roy plays straight but gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg... where Mohammad Nawaz does an impression of a beached seal in his attempt to flick the ball back and allows it to run past him for four
pitched up and driven, off the outer half of the bat, flies to cover
straight line, sliding on to the pads, flicked fine for a couple to get going
length ball outside off, Hales drops back and blocks
another back-foot punch, straight to cover... where Babar Azam sets his long barrier but still fails to stop the ball, zips through his legs and away for the second boundary of the afternoon
touch short outside off, Hales runs a single to third man
good pace from Hasan, 86mph but gun-barrel straight outside off and left alone
slightly uppish push back towards the bowler, taken on the bounce
good length on off stump, Hales pats it back into the off side
length again, 85mph and punched on the up towards mid-off

first successful bit of ground fielding for Pakistan... and Wahab Riaz has nearly injured himself in the process. He gave chase to a flick off the pads through midwicket, hunted the ball down in front of the rope and flicked it back - then collided with the boundary board. But Wahab's a tough sort and shrugs it off
comes forward on off, taps into the covers on the up
skelped back down the ground! The batsmen are very happy trusting the bounce here, on to the front foot again and Roy laces this past the diving mid-off for another four
slower ball from Amir, gently pushed back down the track
comes forward and pushes away from his body, thick-edged past leg stump for one
in the channel, Roy opens the face and runs one to third man
nicely timed, driven square off the back foot, gets it past the man at point and it races away
this one shades back in at 86mph, Hales judges it well and leaves
good pace and a bit of extra bounce for Hasan, jumps and nips Hales on the thigh pad, runs away wide of slip for one
pushed back down the track, tip and run to mid-off, who doesn't take it cleanly anyway

oh, nearly a mix-up, Hales is in the dirt at the non-striker's end! Roy tapped the ball down towards point and was never interested in running, Hales seemed to be at least halfway down by the time he realised... but once again the fielder didn't collect it cleanly and he was able to scramble back on his shirt front
back of a length, 88mph and dabbed down into the covers
good bowling from Amir, this time the slower ball, rises up and hits Roy on the body as he mistimes his glance
short ball, rising up towards the armpit, Roy swats it away, past the man at short fine leg and that's another boundary as England's openers gambol along
nudged off the body, Roy has to get his skates on but the throw to the other end is off target
angled across the bows at 87mph, Hales calmly guides it down to third man
pitched up and driven into the covers, another single pinched

got him, Hasan bellows in delight as Roy gloves a pull to the keeper! They were looking good but they've been separated by the commenter's curse a decent short ball and a slightly rushed shot, Roy was through his pull early and it looped up high to Sarfraz's right. Simple catch, Pakistan have their breakthrough
short of a length on off stump, Root on sentry duty, blocks
shortish again, 85mph and chopped into the ground down to third man
too straight from Hasan and that is fairly middled to the square-leg boundary, just a clip but it flew
comes forward and pushes one into the covers to finish an eventful over
legnth ball, steps on to the front foot and drives, sends it to mid-off
tighter line, 85mph and worked to mid-on with a closed bat face
suckered him, a cutter from Amir, taking the pace off and Hales swishes for it and misses... Sarfraz taking it on the bounce
nudged off the legs, only just to the right of mid-on but the fielder ambles rather slowly after it and they race back for a second to Amir's chagrin
comes across and taps down into the off side
pitched up in the slot and Hales absolutely hammers the ball - straight to cover point
lovely timing, opens the face and plays a trademark glide off the back foot to deep backward point for his first boundary
touch too straight, full and juicy and whipped off the pads for three out to deep midwicket

slower ball, out the back of the hand... and belted back over his head for six! Hales seemed to have got right underneath that shot as he made room for the slog but still had plenty of forward momentum for the ball to carry over the straight boundary. That's the England 50 up, too
back of a length outside off, steered firmly to backward point
touch short again and stabbed towards backward point
closer to the stumps, Hales nudges it back towards mid-on
in the channel, 85mph and glided down to third man for one more
back of a length outside off, 88mph and steered straight to point from the crease
good pace, again pushed square on the off side
Hales stays back and opens the bat face, running one to third man
pitched up in the channel, Root leans into a dreamy looking front-foot drive but picks out the cover fielder
dug in short this time, chin music at 86mph from Wahab, swung down into the ground on the pull
full and wide, Hales was nowhere near the ball... but he swipes at it and manages to get it off the cue end through the covers, bisecting the fielders and it runs away to the rope
tossed up and drifting into the pads, worked to midwicket
comes on to the front foot and dabs into the covers
length ball, skidding on without much turn, Root plays across the line and is hit on the pads - sliding down past leg, I think
uses the feet and nurdles this one into a gap at midwicket for one
tossed up outside off, Hales clumps it through mid-off to the man set back on the fence
little hint of grip on this one, slower through the air and it straightens to hit the leading edge
flighted outside off, Hales comes across and steers through the backward point for one
tossed up and driven down the ground to long-off
gives it some air, dabbed down into the covers
pushed through a little flatter, Hales punches back to the bowler's left
floated up outside off, sits back and chops through point to the sweeper
flat legbreak on off, Root drops it down in front of point and scampers through
floated up on the stumps, Root nudges a single back past the bowler
flighted, presses forward to defend this one
tossed up and spinning away as Hales feels for it, clips the edge but goes quickly to ground as Yasir, fielding at slip, dives after it
shorter length, Hales drops back and works one more down the ground
gives it a bit more air, Root sneaks forwards and pokes into a gap on the off side once agaion
straighter line, Hales can't get it through the ring on the leg side
flighted, bit of drift back into the batsman, punched to Yasir's left and he can only get a hand on it
tossed up straighter and worked away to the leg side
pushed through and nudged off the legs for one more
bit of spin away from Hales as he prods on the back foot, sends it to backward point on the bounce
hoicked over the leg side, Hales has had enough of nurdling singles, down on one knee and carted flat and into a gap for four
here comes Hales but he's not getting to the pitch, slower but dipping fiendishly from Yasir, he grins as the batsman gets away with an inside edge heaving across the line
floated up and driven, a firm spank but straight to cover
Root waits for this one and steers through the covers
pushed through and defended on the back foot around off stump
darted on the stumps, 57mph, Hales flicks it to midwicket
touch shorter and straightening outside off, Hales pokes it into the off side

quicker and sliding on, hits the front leg as Hales plays around it... big appeal from Sarfraz but that was heading down the leg side. Still, good bowling from Nawaz, whose three overs so far have only cost six runs
pushed through outside off and Root chops to backward point
flat-batted through square leg, he's down early for the sweep and this is hammered into the gap
tossed up and worked off the pads for one to midwicket
Hales goes back and stabs the ball into the covers
floated up, out on the front foot this time, punches to long-off
with the leg side reinforced, Root gets cute and attempts to reverse-paddle past short third man, doesn't time it well enough but they pick up one
floated up outside off, Root dances out and steers a drive through extra cover
angled in and Hales can only push back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, again Hales can only block coming forwards
quicker and straighter, Hales not looking entirely comfortable here, hit on the pad playing across the line
floated up and this time he gets on to the front foot and pushes one down the ground
lovely stuff, dipping and straightening past the outside edge as Root plunges forward in defence. Nawaz is landing it on a dime
short ball, 86mph and rising to hit Hales on the body as he tries to pull
short again but ever-so-slightly leg side and Hales doesn't miss out on a freebie four, flicked off his hips - that takes him to fifty, an oasis in a somewhat parched late summer for him
good pace, 87mph in the channel, punched on the up to mid-off
Hales is already looking far more comfortable against pace, dug in short again by Wahab and it's casually flipped through square leg for another boundary
round the wicket now, another bouncer, Hales whirls through a pull, in the air but short of fine leg and they amble through for one
Root comes forward and dabs into the covers for one more
outside off, punched into the covers
tighter line from round the wicket, a measured push to long-off, and there is the 100
forward once again, full face of the bat into the covers
a fraction straighter, worked into the leg side but picked up at mid-on
up onto the toes, an easy single out to deep cover
flicked into the leg side, a tidy over

round the wicket, angling back into the right hander  but keeping low after pitching. Root is beaten past an under-edge, and so too is the keeper who can't drop his glove on the ball as it dies on him
poked out to point with a hop into line
back of a length, angled into the pads, worked to square leg
very wide, and patted down to third man with a fishing-rod flick of the wrists. A decent save on the boundary's edge
full length, tighter line, defended outside off stump

a wild slap into the off side ... now then, that's got miles in the air, Shoaib Malik hurtles in from third man but the ball plugs safely inches from his grasp. Backward point would have swallowed that
forward and poked to cover
tossed up from round the wicket, a fierce shy at the non-striker's end from mid-n, but the only sticks he hits are Nawaz's shins! Ouch
tapped into the covers
back of a length and that is sweetly timed through deep midwicket. Read the length early, rocked back and waited, then picked his spot to perfection
bang, fetch that! In the arc, and Hales loosens his shoulders to deposit a full-blooded wallop over wide long-on
a solid finish to the over, a big stride to defend
stands tall to defend to cover
worked into the leg side, using the angle from round the wicket
solidly blocked back down the wicket
short and sharp, hoisted down the throat of the fielder at deep square leg, but Marais Erasmus has called no-ball from the third umpire's chair!
well, well, what can you do? Another sharp follow-up from Wahab, but Root chances his arm with a stand-and-deliver thwack from the crease, and fizzes a thin edge out of the reach of the keeper!
on the pads, worked into the gap for another single
slower ball, wafted out past point with a loose drive. A nearly-successful-but-in-the-end-very-costly over
round the wicket, clipped out to midwicket to bring up the 100 stand
tight line, defended back down the pitch
squirted out to point with a premeditated reverse sweep
nurdled into the gap
onto the front foot, pushed to wide mid-off
worked down to third man
short and wide, Hales rocks back early, waits to pull the trigger, and flat-bats it through midwicket
slammed high and handsome over deep midwicket! Hales is taking utter command now ...
another premeditated smear into the leg side, but this time he doesn't quite nail it
outside off, a controlled cut that Yasir at backward point does well to claw back
crashing drive through the covers! There are holes in the field everywhere, as Pakistan seek to plug the gap at cow corner but leave a gaping wound in the off instead ...
dragged down, dragged across the line, beats the field at midwicket and that is a 20-run over
onto the front foot, yorker length, but wide line, dabbed to point
full face, pushed out to point
wide line again, eased into the deep
nips back into the pads from back of a length, but Root watches it onto the middle of a controlled flick to leg
tighter line, solid in defence
full length, Root drills it back to the bowler and swishes the ground in annoyance. He really doesn't like not scoring
width, it was there for the shot, a chop down to third man, but he just misses out
on the pads, whisked away
short, pounded up to cover with the spin
full length, drilled down to long off, he's onto 99
worked into the covers off the back foot to bring his partner back onto strike...

short and leg-sided, the sort of delivery you'd beg to be served up on 99. Eased into the leg side, and at the precise halfway mark of the innings, Alex Hales has a superb 83-ball hundred to his name!
tight line, but thumped down to deep point
worked into the gap once more, singles everywhere you look. Like Fresher's week
very full length, angled into the pads, straight to the man this time
banged in short, a slow bouncer, and Hales was through the shot a full two seconds before the ball thumped him a painful blow on the shoulder
fuller length, clubbed on the up into the covers
angled into the off stump, solid defence on the back foot
tossed up, Hales advances and clubs a drive down to long-off
a fraction wider, can't connect with his wipe through the covers
pushed into the covers
worked to leg
good delivery in the blockhole, Hales had freed his front leg, but had to readjust to a faster, flatter ball
no cutting that one off, a flat-batted biff through the covers. It's getting messy out there
tight line from over the wicket, defended into the covers
on the pads, clipped out to deep square leg
whistles through at chest-height, another slower-ball bouncer. Hales doesn't pick that one either
short and panned out to deep midwicket. Hales pivots in his followthrough
width, tapped into the covers with a bit of a reach
clever batting, the Root nurdle through third man, and that is Root's fifth fifty in consecutive ODI innings. And he has barely even started his day's work, it would seem
spanked on the up, over wide long-off. Lovely batting
onto the front foot, can't quite time his drive
worked into the gap again
frees the front leg, and battered over long-on! Another brutal dismissive blow
smashed into the covers and dropped by Azhar! A fierce, head-high chance, but my goodness, Pakistan needed that to stick ...
panned into the stands! So much height it is threatening a few passing satellites, and just has the legs to plop on the outfield, over the rope, and hop over the fence
clipped off the pads
wide full toss, panned out to point
Root looks to flick a length ball over his shoulder, Amir sees him changing his stance and fires the ball wider. Root tries to re-re-adjust but can't connect. A whole lot of not a lot
tight line, inside-edged defence down into the crease
short, and fiercely pulled down to Shoaib on the square-leg boundary. Good shot for one
two more, to bring up England's highest partnership for any wicket in ODIs against Pakistan
outside off, poked down to third man
worked down to third man once again
short and wide, flashed through third man. No cutting that one off!
tight defence on the back foot
short and sharp, but pinged out to midwicket with another swivelling pull
leading edge into the off side as Hales is squared up on the back foot. A decent cutter, and partially deceived off the deck
oof, Hales by rights should have lost his middle stump there as he leaned back for a cut, but the ball just managed to hop over the top of the bails
more measured defence on the front foot
another Rootian nurdle to relinquish the strike
short and wide, slapped in the air but Yasir can't claw it in with a full-length dive at point!
power and placement, spanked through the covers. Just made room outside leg to free the hands. Nothing much wrong with the ball. Plenty right with the footwork
down the track, flicked out to deep midwicket. Hales marches on
round the wicket, hoisted with the angle behind square on the leg side. Just a pick-up-and-place shot, dragged around the corner like a shepherd with a crook
swatted into the leg-side, another slower-ball bouncer, which Hales met at head-height with a downwards thud of bat
back of a length, jabbed down to third man
short again, pulled again. Four ... again. Whistles through midwicket and that is the highest individual score by an England batsman against Pakistan. Not to mention the 200 stand
gets into line to defend
width, too much width. Hales tries to reach it with a stab of his toe-end
a massive wind-up, a fat toe-end, out of the reach of Sarfraz behind the stumps, and that is Hales's 150!
flat on off, Root skips out and works to leg, finds midwicket
floated up a little straighter and Root sweeps, short fine leg gets to it but the throw to the non-striker's end is poor
on the stumps, Hales works it off his legs and the man at short fine leg misfields to give them one more
gets the reverse-sweep away, tossed up outside off and swatted to the third man boundary, the runs continue to flow
gives it some air, Root sweeps in conventional fashion, he's hit on the body and it scurries away past Sarfraz - lbw appeal from Malik but he was outside the line
darted flat on the stumps, Root clips to midwicket again
round the wicket, fired full in the channel and Hales misses attempting to chop down on it
full outside off and this time squeezed to backward point, they pinch one
more pongo for Pakistan, short outside off and Root nonchalantly sits back and slaps a pull up and over midwicket to the fence
fullish, up towards the blockhole, dug out through mid-on
smeared through the covers, four more! A half-volley served up outside off and Hales helps himself

on the stumps, smashed off a length over midwicket, another dismissive blow and the ball sails over the infield, wide of long-on, a third boundary in the over and Hales is up to 160 - just Roy and The Judge ahead of him
lovely shot from Root, steps out and strokes an orthodox cover drive in front of the man at deep point for four more
flighted, spanked on the drive again but finds the fielder
tossed up and Root comes out to nurdle one more back past the bowler
tossed up straight on middle stump, delicately swept, gets it away fine and that's yet another boundary - Hales goes past Roy's score from The Oval against SL earlier this summer
shortish outside off, sits back and thwacks a cut out to the deep cover sweeper
floated up, Root is down on one knee to sweep, it sails out towards deep square leg and then the bounce nearly wrong-foots the fielder, they get two more
shortish outside off, stays back and stabs the ball towards point

leg-stump yorker from Hasan, think that snuck under the bat to hit the back leg... not given but Pakistan review the lbw. How close was this? Think it might be sneaking down but to the DRS we go. Marais Erasmus is happy that Hales didn't hit it, swinging across the line, so Hawk-Eye will have the final say: well, it actually pitched outside leg, so we won't even get to the ball-tracker. Hales can carry on regardless
high full toss, Root exclaims as he rocks back and angles it to third man... well played, and it's a no-ball
full, up in the blockhole at 85mph, Hales swings hard but only manages to toe a single down the ground to long-on
dropped down into the leg side, Root sets off straight away, there's a direct hit from midwicket... but he was home

short ball, sits up to be clubbed over midwicket - Hales has done it, the highest ODI score by an England batsman! Hales didn't realise to begin with but, as the crowd rises to applaud, he becomes aware and breaks out in a wide grin. What a way to end a rough trot of form

full and straight, given out lbw! Hales reviews but this looks pretty adjacent... Yep, Hawk-Eye says the ball was thundering into leg stump and Hales' merry bash is over, the crowd rises again, on his home ground he walks off with 171 to his name. He tucked in today
tossed up on the stumps, worked to the leg side for one
some turn and bounce here, spinning past Buttler's outside edge as he hangs back
length ball, waits in the crease and pats it down towards point, another dot for Nawaz
tossed up and punched back to the bowler, Nawaz fields to his right
floated up and this time Buttler gets to the pitch and eases one down the ground

skidding on, into the gloves, Pakistan celebrate... and up goes the finger! Root was attempting to force the ball off the back foot, he got the thinnest of edges but Sarfraz knew, he held on and Pakistan have got both set batsmen in the space of seven balls. Root looks miffed to have missed out on a century but it was another fine knock
back of a length outside off, Buttler tries to flay over the covers, swings and misses
angled in with the arm, bit of nip and bounce, hit high on the pads... lbw appeal primly rejected
good length outside off, maybe taking some of the pace off, Morgan dabs at it and misses
shuffles forward, pushed into the off side and this will be tight, mid-off has a shy as Morgan dives for the non-striker's end... but misses
another nip-backer, cramps Buttler and hits him just above the knee roll, again the lbw appeal falls on deaf ears
finishs the over with a full toss and a boundary, Buttler clubbing off his legs gets things moving again
over the wicket, tossed up and nudged back to the bowler's right
Morgan skips out and works one down to long-on
Buttler steps out and splunks the ball straight over long-on! Muscular bottom-handed mow and it sails over the rope
even bigger, an astonishing strike into the stands! Nawaz goes the distance again, tossed up and into Buttler's arc, he wandered out and drilled it into orbit. The cameraman had no idea where it went
flatter outside off and Buttler takes pity, pokes one through the covers
six more, three in the over and that's put a dent in Nawaz's figures! Morgan joins in with the fun, down on one knee and swatted into the top tier of the stand over long-on
length ball outside off, Buttler swings and fails to connect
scooped to fine leg, four more! Full and straight but Buttler simply steps across and flips it where he wants
dug in short, Buttler mistimes a pull into the turf... but he's overstepped again
goes full and wide and Buttler bludgeons it through the covers, out oft he screws, flies over the rope on the bounce
on the stumps, Buttler works it away for a single through square leg
better line from Hasan, prodded back through mid-on by Morgan to rotate the strike
short outside off, Buttler crunches a cut powerfully but straight to deep point for one more
here he comes again, a soft-shoe shuffle and Buttler carts the ball way back over long-on for his third maximum!
fired down on leg stump, clipped through backward square leg for one
goes round the wicket, flat and quick on the pads as Morgan advances, nudged to midwicket
tossed up and creamed over long-off for six more, Buttler is on the charge, like Godzilla stomping all over Tokyo!

murderous! Malik drops short and Buttler rocks back to cart the ball high over long-on! There's a bloke who tries to take the catch beyond the boundary and nearly impales himself on a fence... but he's up and celebrating straight away. No one on the field was getting near it

that's been hammered, high towards long-on, there's two fielders converging... but it drops beyond them and over the rope, taking Buttler past fifty from just 22 balls, the quickest in ODIs for England
good ball, nipping back in past the inside edge as Morgan is cramped for room

launched, high towards deep midwicket... Hasan Ali takes the catch, but he can't hold on as he heads over the rope! Does well to toss it back inside but he can't complete the dismissal. Saved a couple, though
on the stumps, Morgan works it off his body for one - that's the England 350, another staging post in today's Wacky Race
banged in short, good bouncer from Amir, Buttler swings hard but misses
Amir digs it in again, maybe a slower ball, Buttler rolls his wrists on a flat pull
decent from Amir, full and fast, Morgan has to dig it out into the leg side
sliced into the off side, above the backpedalling Yasir, who drops it! The slower ball did for Morgan but Wahab doesn't get his reward. The wheels are off again
tight line, back of a length, Morgan doesn't connect this time
slapped over long-on, Morgan clears the decks, clears the ropes, swings through the line, six more!
short and wide, lacerated through backward point, fast hands and away the ball skitters, England are dealing in custard pies!
back of a length, swings hard and gets a bottom edge towards point
bouncer to finish, Buttler tries to ramp it over short fine leg but misses out and umpire Kettleborough is happy it isn't a wide
picked up and slotted over long-on! The blows continue to rain down, a sweet strike through the line and that's another Dorothy, thankyouverymuch
full and straight, big swing, thick inside edge, beats fine leg! Amir can only laugh in despair
length ball outside off, Morgan smears it through the covers, that's going to beat deep cover! More boozily satisfied cheers around TB
some respite, as Morgan skips out and drives one to long-on
full toss, Buttler clubs it down the ground, long-on runs across to cut it off

Amir gets it through, full and on the leg side as Buttler swings over the top of it, Sarfraz does well to stop it running away but they pinch a bye - and that's the 100-run stand from just seven overs!
slower ball, dupes the batsman... but it bounces over the stumps!
bit of width, has to reach but gets a toe of bat on it, squirts down to third man
Morgan starts advancing down the pitch, Wahab fires it down the leg side... Wide
slower ball, in the channel outside off, Morgan swats one through point, bit top-edgey
taking the pace off again, loops over the stumps as Buttler heaves across the line and misses

short ball, Buttler is in a bit of a tangle pulling with one hand off the bat, goes straight to square leg but Wahab can't gather the throw with the batsman struggling for the other end. Another sloppy moment in the field for Pakistan
pitched up, a low full toss that is mistimed into the midwicket region, they scuttle back for two - still, not the worst over from Wahab, no boundaries in it
short ball, impudently flicked over the keeper! Buttler ramps things up even further with his tenth boundary
shuffles across and misses as Amir goes full and wide, maybe a slower ball
Amir aims for the wide yorker again... but this time Buttler slaps a forehand smash through backward point, such quick hands and he steers it behind the man in the deep for four more!
Amir is round the wicket and fires it down the leg side as Buttler shifted across again, looking for the scoop - touch harsh to be wided
full, right up in the blockhole, Buttler jams down on it and inside-edges past his stumps, they hustle for the second to fine leg - and that's the England 400, for only the second time in ODIs!
pitched up, another yorker, good stuff from Amir, swipes at it and dug out for one
fired in on leg stump, Morgan gets a tickle of bat on it... and a poor effort at fine leg gives England another boundary. Amir has every right to look cheesed off after that
Buttler hasn't quite got his scoop going, again he moves outside off but misses and is lucky not to be bowled
plonked beyond the ropes, disdainfully done by Buttler, carting Wahab over deep midwicket to bring up England highest ODI score!

bowled him, the fun comes to an end... oh no it doesn't! This is end-of-the-pier stuff, a real shoddy performance from Pakistan. Wahab had overstepped by a distance and Buttler will be called back. To cap it off, the ball flew for four after hitting the stumps!
good comeback, slower ball, swings to leg and misses
on the stumps, Buttler stepped away and miscues it through the covers for one
on a length and heaved gleefully into the stands at deep midwicket! Morgan goes to fifty from 24 balls, the slowcoach... Brings up Wahab's gallon, too

six more, another casual blow, baseball-style over deep midwicket! The England fans are chucking beer all over each other trying to catch these... And Wahab ends just shy of Mick Lewis' worst-bowling record, too
good ball from Amir, full outside off and a precious dot
fired in on the stumps, turned through the leg side for a couple more
just a fraction off in the slot and Buttler smears it through the covers for four more! Are you keeping up? I think my computer is struggling!
Buttler backs away and smashes a couple more through the covers
on a length, quick and slightly leg side, Buttler pulls across the line misses
a good finish from Amir, squeezed out through cover for one - he's finished with 0 for 72 but bowled far better than that
back of a length, Buttler walks out and hammers a pull that actually hits Morgan as he was setting off to run, deflected away through mid-off - no damage done as he threw up his hands in self-defence
length outside off, Morgan fails to connect with a wild swing
another swing and a miss from Morgan, perhaps done by the slower ball, but they run a bye to get Buttler on strike
good delivery from Hasan, back-of-the-hand slower ball, outside off and Buttler misses
what's going on?! Again Buttler throws his weight on to the back foot and heaves wildly but fails to get bat on ball!

slower ball to finish, but he gets hold of this one, powered over extra cover! That's it, England have set a new ODI record total! The crowd may be drunk on sixes but they're aware of what's just happened - England's one-day revolution just keeps rolling on

inn2.comm: big shout to launch the innings! Wicket to wicket delivery, but perhaps pitched outside leg before clattering into pad ... Actually, had England reviewed, that would have been out!
outside off, that's a feisty line, angling back into the left-hander, who just about leaves alone
outside off, jabbed down to third man
back of a length, climbing into the left-hander who defends compactly
outside off, and Pakistan are properly up and running, a well-timed thump off the back foot through the covers
pitches outside leg for sure this time. Strikes the pad and Wood's appeal is half-hearted. His pace, 94mph, is anything but
width outside off, a good-looking square drive on the up but well fielded at backward point
lifting from a tight line, a cramped back-foot drive/pull dribbles into the covers
banged in short, Rashid at fine leg is on hand to gather a well-timed pull on the bounce
full length, draw forward to defend
well bowled, exploding off a good length and beating a tentative prod
banged in short, that's well placed, a calm swivel-pull into the gap at midwicket. A composed start from this pair
outside off, a loose poke but a well-placed one in the end. Got enough bat on a deliberate steer to beat Stokes' vain dive at wide second slip
tighter line, dabbed down to third man
short, banged into the hip, pulled fine
another well-placed dab off the back foot, pinching another single to third man
on the pads, and that is very well timed indeed. Flicked firmly in front of square. They are doing the needful so far ...
squared up a touch by a back-of-a-length lifter. A decent start from this pair
defended into the off side
chopping towards third man again, but this time slip is in place to cut off the runs
back of a length, an eager pull but not well timed. Mid-on tidies up
banged in short, Aslam climbs into a pull but splices it in his over-eagerness. Square leg makes no mistake, and there is the breakthrough!
tight line, defended into the off side
on the pads, worked into the leg side
ping! That is a fantastic thwack through the leg side, Sharjeel has gauged the good nature of this pitch nice and early, and launched into a pull from a ball that wasn't massively short
worked into the leg side again but can't beat the field this time
very full, on the pads, and that's another fine strike. A full face of the bat, punched through mid-on. Well played
spanked into the leg side where Rashid fumbles at mid-on, and grimaces at his error. Rightly so ...
outside off, drilled to cover
on the pads, tucked square, and that races away to the boundary once again. This is a tremendous start from Sharjeel who is doing everything he can to stay with the rate
outside off, a calm push into the covers, and for the second time in two overs, a flimsy bit of fielding gifts needless runs. They've got a few to play with, but that's pretty shoddy ...
worked into the leg side
pushed on the up through mid-on, that is a fantastic strike, a genuine on-drive - you don't see many that well played and placed
defended into the leg side
angled defence as Woakes tightens his line
outside off, Rashid at third man slips as he gathers but manages not to fumble badly this time
neat straight drive, back down the ground
strikes the pad and deflects into the leg side
worked to leg
thumped into the covers
eased out to square leg
banged in short, lots of venom on that one, but too high, say the umpires. They might just have a point
through to the keeper without an extra this time
banged in short and battered handsomely over deep midwicket! Well, why not! Doesn't middle it as they cross for two, but it's a liberating attitude
fuller and straighter, defended back down the track
outside off, Azhar has another fling of the bat  but the ball skews off a fat outside edge, all the way to Rashid at third man. No fumble this time, and Pakistan's captain is gone
tight defence
hoisted into the leg side, using the pace
right behind the line and punching into the covers
beautiful timing! It's Sharjeel versus England at present, and all things being equal (which they aren't...) he's winning. A fine pinged pull through square leg
on the pads once again and another flipped four off the hip! He is smoking the pace of this pitch, and Wood's pace for that matter, he's consistently in the 90s
fuller length, outside off, and deposited handsomely over long-on for a one-bounce four! He saw it coming, and sent it flying!
flipped off the hip yet again, it's like watching Brian Lara! Up comes the front leg as he pivots on the back, and Wood is getting a pasting!
banged in short from round the wicket. Grr

flipped off the hip ... straight to Hales at backward square ... who drops it! That was an absolute goober! A bit of a top edge from Sharjeel, the trap had been set and down it goes. Just as well he's got runs to fall back on, as Hales' fielding has been a liability of late ...
that's his shot! On the pads, paddled round the corner and timed to perfection past backward square
outside off, Sharjeel slaps another four through the covers, and that is a 26-ball fifty, with 12 fours! Forty-eight in fours ...
back of a length, another firm pull but straight to mid-on
slower ball, that was cleverly disguised, hopping under another expansive pull and dribbling past the off stump

belted! Just an inch short of a good length, and pounded over the leg side! Give him an inch and he'll take a mile. Exclusively through the leg side, of course. But it is giving England plenty to ponder

belted out to deep midwicket, and if Hales is the shoddiest pair of hands on the England team, then Ben Stokes is Mr Bucket Hands. Straight into his mitts, and a bold innings comes to a fittingly belligerent end
outside off, good length, compact defence to cover
tapped out to cover
outside off, wristily guided down to third man
a flowing drive,  but hoovered up in the covers
on the pads, attempted nurdle but can't beat the field
nice strike, straight back down the pitch
decent length outside off, defended to third man
tight line, defended back down the track
slower ball, tight line, defended to gully
outside off, dabbed through point with a bit of a stretch
another slower ball, deflected to third man
tapped into the leg side to keep the strike rotating
banged in short, beats a hurried if half-committed pull
nothing half-committed about that one! Picked the length early, pivoted gloriously into the stroke, and dumped it over midwicket for one bounce
tip and run ... Stokes at cover has a shy and clatters Sarfraz's ankles as he scampers for the crease
worked to leg once more
back of a length, pounced on at cover by a leaping Stokes, who was already lining up a shy in mid-air
on the pads, worked to deep midwicket
well bowled, a yorker length inches inside the tramline. Babar leaves alone, hoping for the wide
defended back up the pitch, off the back foot
outside off, filleted down to third man
on the pads, worked to square leg. The hundred is up, in decent time
outside off, a bit of a windy whoosh of a drive. Finds thin air
tight line to finish
compact defence into the leg side
short, pulled, high and handsome in front of square. Root is patrolling the boundary but he can't get close! One bounce and onto the concourse
angled into the pads, flicked straight to Wood at short backward square
on the pads, flicked away
pushed into the covers
tapped off the toes, out to deep midwicket

Stokes has his first wicket of the series! Angled down the leg side, Azam attempted a leg-glance, but somehow muffed a leading edge out to short cover for Morgan to snaffle the easiest chance of the day
length ball on the stumps, pushed back down the track
touch shorter outside off, swished to backward point
tight lines, over the top of off, Malik diligently blocks again and I'm slowly being transported back to his 245 in Abu Dhabi last year...
beaten, has a little dabble this time, past the outside edge
on the stumps, Malik stays back and clips a single through square leg to the man on the fence - a wicket and a single off the over, not a good one for Pakistan
shortish, rising sharply outside off, hops across and defends
slammed in short once again, a slightly leg-side bumper, Malik sways inside it... called wide, to Plunkett's disappointment

good pace, draws him forward, nicks the edge - gone! In the channel at 90mph and that's enough to chisel out Malik with a whimper, 1 off seven balls, Buttler throws the ball up in celebration and Pakistan are five down with a mountainous mountain to climb
angled across from over the wicket, the left-hander prods it away
on the stumps, worked to leg and they scamper through for one
pitched up on off stump, Sarfraz drives and gets an inside edge through backward square leg for a couple
Sarfraz stomps forward, the field marshal attempting to rouse the troops, flicks wristily through square leg for one more
length ball on the stumps, tucked towards mid-on
off-stump line, comes forward but can't get it through the infield

dabbed down into the covers, they think about one but it's never there, Nawaz has to pull a U-turn but he manages to dive for his ground as Morgan tossed a rather gentle throw to Stokes, who had to turn and break the stumps - too late
touch too straight, whipped off the legs, Plunkett does tremendously well on the rope to prevent four
offcutter from Stokes, loses his line down the leg side
outside off, another slower ball, mistimed on the cut into the covers
lovely stroke, scooches forward and drills a full ball wide of mid-off, glides to the rope as if on rails
round the wicket to Nawaz, slammed in short, 87mph and veering back at the throat, does well to limbo underneath it
shortish outside off, tapped down square
straighter line, hits the padding as he plays to leg
length in the channel, Nawaz waits and slides the ball down to third man for a single
on the stumps, full and straight as Sarfraz pushes at it, chipped it in the air but short of mid-on
back of a length, 86mph, dropped watchfully into the covers
round the wicket, tossed up, Nawaz leans into a gentle forward prod
flighted, comes forward and steers a drive down to long-off
over the wicket, tossed up and there's a bit of grip comes off the splice as he drives, not far from carrying back to the bowler
dragged down as Sarfraz comes galloping out, has to adjust and fend it away of the pads
flat trajectory, drops back and punches another single to long-on
pushed through outside off from round the wicket, Nawaz guides one more to third man
round the wicket and hammered into the middle of the pitch at 88mph, Nawaz hastily jabs it away from his throat
over the wicket to Sarfraz, back of a length on middle and leg, 87mph and thudding into the pads
slightly short outside off, Sarfraz defuses it into the covers
unlucky for Plunkett but they all count on the scorecard, Sarfraz chopping an inside edge past his stumps, beats short fine leg and runs for four
touch short, drops back and guides one more to third man
Nawaz shows a bit more intent, hitting over the top but he'll only get a couple, came high off the bat and cleared extra cover before plugging in the outfield
tossed up on the stumps and swept effectively, gets it away through backward square
tries to come down the track and Moeen follows him, shortens his length, hits the pads
Sarfraz comes forward again, Moeen drops short again, misses out
tossed up on the stumps, blocked coming forwards
again he shuffles out to narrow the angle, settle for a flick through backward square leg
round the wicket, floated up and driven into the covers
starts with a long hop that Sarfraz clouts straight to cover
gives this one some air, gets a bit of turn as Sarfraz skips out and man=ages to chip a leading edge back over the leaping bowler for one
drops a bit short again outside off, sits back and flat-bats to mid-off
floated up on the stumps, plays with the turn this time and nudges one to leg
drags the ball down, Sarfraz again mistimes a wallop, nearly scoops it straight to mid-on
pushed through outside off, Sarfraz drops back and squirts a couple through point
Nawaz heaves high into the on side, gets plenty on it and clears the ring, won't quite carry all the way... but the attempt to reel it in front of the rope doesn't succeed either
short outside off, drops back to cut firmly but backward point leaps after it, well stopped
floated up, pushes down slightly the wrong line, thick-edged wide of slip for a couple
touch short outside off, Nawaz drops back to cut, in the air but wide of the diving Root at slip and it runs away
whoops, there's the Moeen moon ball, a high full toss that Nawaz swats through point for a couple more
tossed up and driven coming forwards, mid-on does well to cut this off on the dive
drags it down a little, stays back and slaps through the covers, they get back for two
Sarfaz, batting in a cap, heaves meatily across the line and misses a spinning legbreak

floats it up a touch wider, again he attempts to hit the ball into next week... and a big top edge is taken by slip walking a few yards to his left! Sarfraz slog-sweeps himself into oblivion and Pakistan's best hope of respectability departs
slightly short, spinning away, swatted through mid-off
tossed up on the stumps, worked through midwicket
oh, he didn't pick the googly, no sir! Dipping and spinning back in as Hasan shouldered arms, the Bosie was an inch or so from toppling off stump
looped up on the stumps, makes room to hit inside to out and picks up one through the covers
flat offbreak on the stumps, Hasan goes back and defends
comes forward and pushes into the covers
going on with the arm, into the gloves as Hasan feels for it outside off
touch short, drops back on off stump stabs the ball to long-off
worked through the leg side for one
tossed up from round the wicket, poked into the off side
on the stumps, miscued into the leg side
beaten outside off, the ball spinning past the bat as Hasan has a big old yahoo
full and dipping on the stumps, gets down to sweep the ball fine
flighted from over the wicket on leg stump, paddled down towards fine leg for a couple
pushed through outside off, cut for one behind square
tossed up on the stumps, can't get it away
floated up, goes down to sweep a single

bowled him, spinning through the gate! Hasan would have been stumped if the ball hadn't hit its mark, he was well down the pitch and played all around it, Moeen's offbreak coming back in to hit the top of off and leave Pakistan clinging grimly to the ropes
flighted, spinning to hit the front pad as Wahab attempts to play to leg
gives it some air, slow and loopy, poked into the covers
tossed up a little wide of the stumps, Wahab reaches for the slog-sweep but fails to connect
length ball, again turning back in and Wahab is this far from chopping on to his wicket
floated up on the stumps, padlded away through backward square leg
Wahab gets off the mark with a nudge through the leg side
tossed up on middle and off, gently pushed back down the track
leg-stump line, Nawaz signals his intentions early but even as Buttler and Root ran across to try and intercept the paddle, he managed to get it away
clipped through the leg sided to the man in the deep
tossed up on the stumps, Wahab unleashes a flat sweep, gets a hold of it and gives Woakes a workout on the square-leg boundary - he does well to prevent four diving full length
round the wicket, bit of turn outside off, slapped into the covers
angled in with the arm, Nawaz comes out and drives through mid-on
comes forwards and works the ball towards mid-on, Morgan's underarm isn't far shy of hitting at the non-striker's end
tossed up, Nawaz drives through the coers to the sweeper for one
some turn back in as Wahab drives outside off, hits the splice of the bat
on the stumps, nudged gently to the leg side
dragged down on the stumps, Nawaz drops back and whirls a pull out to deep midwicket
pushed through on off stump, punched back to the bowler
flighted, on the stumps and swept firmly, one more to deep square leg
on the stumps, Nawaz heaves at it in ungainly fashion and... somehow the ball misses everything! Turned too much, past leg stump and the keeper, running away to the fence
flighted, the googly outside off... and driven to mid-off! Rather flumped it straight to the man and Nawaz's average plummets back into double-figures. Nothing going right for Pakistan here
legbreak on leg stump, goes back and works across the line, hit on the thigh
back of length, sliding down the leg side, swish and a miss - well, that won't help him
straight line and worked off the legs for one
shortish, 86mph outside off, Yasir hangs back and blocks into the covers
pitched up and pushed into the off side and Yasir gets forward
touch short outside off, again dabbed down watchfully in front of square
straight through him, might as well as have used a teleporter, so little hope had Yasir of hitting that... Flew straight over the stumps
back of a length, 88mph and nudged to midwicket for a single. Pakistan refusing to keel over completely...
pushed through outside off and that's a cheeky shot from Yasir, a late cut that he manages to bottom-edge past the keeper for four
half an appeal for lbw as Yasir defends on middle and leg
the googly, drops a bit short and Yasir heaves it into the leg side, bounces just short of deep square
tossed up on the stumps, nudged into a gap at midwicket for a couple
pushed out the front of the hand, Wahab attempts to sweep, doesn't really connect
outside off, stabbed into the covers for one
full and tailing in at 89mph, Wahab gets a bit of inside edge on a flick to leg
shortish outside off, Yasir drops back and cuts into the ground
banged in, 87mph and rising towards the collar bone, fended to square leg for one more
steps out to drive on the up, pushed to cover
Wood slips in the yorker, 89mph and homing in on the timbers, Wahab drops his bat on it in time
slower ball, in the channel outside off, Yasir flails at it unsuccessfully
angled defence, falls short of slip
back of a length, an eager pull to square leg
tossed up, skids on, cut to point
defended into the leg side
a spiralling top-edge, who wants this? No-one, as it happens. Plops to earth in no-man's land at midwicket!
crunched into the covers
banged in short, a delicate pull to short midwicket, just helped into the gap

angling in, strikes the pad on the back foot, and up goes the finger! An instant review, looked a bit leg-sided, and was there bat involved? Nope, don't think so ... and it is clipping leg, so Wahab's resistance is done!
hopping across the stumps and worked to leg
short and sharp, Amir ducks
worked out to midwicket, a wild shy comes in but tidied up in the end
sharp turn from a leg-stump line, a googly to the left-hander
down on one knee to mow a legbreak into the leg side, off an under-edge
stands up to be smacked out to deep cover
heaved across the line and effectively so! In the slot for a violent mow through midwicket
same shot, even more intent, and with that, Pakistan have avoided their heaviest defeat in ODI history!
out pops the googly, Amir doesn't pick it as he winds into another wild fling of bat
pounding into the covers
deflected down to third man
leaning back and walloped violently over long-on! Made loads of room, and pulled out a followthrough that wouldn't have looked out of place on Darren Gough at Sydney in 1994-95
another wind-up but Wood beats him this time

short, spanked high into the night sky, Buttler gallops out to square leg and lets the chance slide through his fingers. Not dissimilar to Sarfraz's spill at the Ageas Bowl. Except maybe a bit easier!
through to the keeper, not much luck for Wood today
solidly forward, and blocked
swinging into the leg side
wow, have some of that! Amir retreats almost to the square leg umpire, then launches into a ferocious angry drive through the covers. Cathartic
flicked to leg
battered on the up and out to deep midwicket
low full toss, heaved out to deep midwicket
hopping onto the back foot, and dabbed into the covers
outside off, dabbed down to third man
a nugget of width and crashed through the hands of point. That was travelling but another moderately ropey bit of fielding, but the usually reliable Stokes this time
outside off, through to the keeper
up on the toes, defended to the off side
attempted yorker from round the wicket, but it comes out as a low full toss that the furiously focussed Amir bashes clean through the covers. He's playing as if it's not a lost cause ...
outside off, turning away, pushed to cover
big turning legbreak from back of a length, heaved to midwicket
down on one knee to sweep
tossed up, into the toes, and hammered high and handsome into the stands at long-on!
battered! Another full-blooded swipe into the leg side! And Amir has the highest score ever by a No.11 in ODIs!
fifty for Amir, off 22 balls, and what a way to get there! Tossed up by Rashid and launched into the night sky, straight down the ground! Not even Buttler could go at a quicker rate than this ...
outside off, climbing past the edge, was there a nick? Not convinced, but Buttler fumbled either way
dabbed into the covers
good bowling, from round the wicket, dabbed backwards of square, and they get the single after all as another wild shy comes in
slammed into the covers, half a chance for Root but that was through his fingers before he could react
slapped high into the off side, lands safe
slammed high over the leg side, Root leaps like a flying fox but can't intercept
back and across, defended to third man, and an angry shy comes in

short, slammed high into the leg side, Buttler hurtles after the ball once again, and puts in an heroic swallow dive, but was never there. I think he winded himself on impact there, but good commitment
banged in way too short outside off, and England's frustration continues!
in the slot, Amir leans back and batters another full-blooded wipe over wide long-on. Straining for the yorker, but serving up a half-volley
short , Amir aims once too violently across the line, a top-edge into the night sky, Woakes steadies himself in the followthrough and pockets the series-winning catch!
